intro: Koanophyllon celtidifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf goldenweed, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink to reddish in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Koanophyllon celtidifolium is adapted to harsh, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
